summary: Ngo Dinh Can is mentioned in three documents. While the documents do not directly detail his actions, his name appears in reports concerning political instability and opposition to the Ngo Dinh Diem regime in South Vietnam. One document discusses opposition in Khanh Hoa Province, potentially reflecting on the broader political climate under the Diem regime, of which Ngo Dinh Can was a part. Another document details apprehensions regarding political events in South Vietnam and their potential to undermine President Ngo Dinh Diem's regime. The third document details a plan for a coup d'etat in Central Vietnam.
significance: The documents suggest Ngo Dinh Can was part of the Ngo Dinh Diem regime in South Vietnam, a regime facing internal opposition and coup plots. While the documents do not directly link him to the JFK assassination, the political instability in South Vietnam during this period is a relevant context.
